newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE MONEY RATES MIXED IN THURSDAY TRADE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE MONEY RATES MIXED IN THURSDAY TRADE.

text.p: Short-term trading rates on Zimbabwe's money market were quoted mixed in quiet trade on Thursday, dealers said.
They said the Reserve Bank offered treasury bills worth Z$300 million to discount houses but rejected as too high all the bids brought forward, which ranged between 17.50 and 18 percent.
Discount houses were selling treasury bills on the secondary market at 16.60 percent, up from Wednesday's 16.35 percent, but call money eased to 16 from 16.25 percent.

NCD bills maturing after 30, 60 and 90 days were being bought and sold at 17 and 16.75 percent respectively, down from 17.25 and 17 percent. Bank bills were at 16.65 percent (buying) from 16.75 and at 16.60 percent from 16.50 on the sell side.
Reserve Bank figures showed the market closed on Wednesday with a slight surplus of Z$81 million.
